summary: Rebuild the backend canister to address recurring connection/login failure (yellow “Retry Connection” screen) when opening the site.
architectural_notes: App runs on the Internet Computer; frontend depends on a backend canister that can temporarily stop, causing connection retry/login failure.
known_issues: Opening the site can immediately show a yellow “Retry Connection” screen due to the backend canister stopping, preventing login until it recovers/retry is clicked.

existing_features.title: Improve the frontend startup recovery behavior for backend-unavailable scenarios (e.g., reject code 5 / canister stopped) by adding automatic retry/backoff before showing the terminal error screen, and ensure the “Retry Connection” action fully re-initializes startup (actor + profile) without requiring a full page reload.

new_feature_requests.summary: Rebuild the backend canister cleanly to resolve recurring “Retry Connection”/login failure on site load.

Rebuild and redeploy the Motoko backend canister cleanly so the app no longer opens to a recurring “Backend Service Unavailable / Backend canister is stopped (Reject code: 5)” screen on initial load, and the canister responds reliably to requests after deployment.
